page.title: 04WORKERS IN HEADCORN
page.content: Although most of the area is given over to agriculture,this does not provide many work opportunities for the residents. Two or three full-time workers to each farm and seasonal help from local women is the general pattern. These women do such tasks as pruning,weeding and fruit picking. Foreman's,which is an Agricultural Merchants, and Woodcock's,which is a Haulage Company provide work for both men and women as office staff,drivers and representatives. The shops and offices within the village employ quite a number of people,some of whom come from outside the immediate area. The majority of people probably work outside the village in towns such as Maidstone,Ashford or the Medway Towns. Many commute to London - journey time just over an hour. The unemployment rate is fortunately quite low.
